Class JavaLex

  • java.lang.Object
    • JavaLex

  • public class JavaLex
extends java.lang.Object
    This class encodes an Alphabet to support the DFA used in parsing Horn Clauses. The static method check recognizes the following alphabet:
    • SmLtr any lower-case letter
    • CapLtr any upper-case letter
    • LtrOrDig a-z, A-Z, 0-9, and underscore.
    • LeftParen '('
    • RightParen ')'
    • LeftAngle '<'
    • NonLeftAngle anything but '<'
    • RightAngle '>'
    • NonRightAngle anything but '>'
    • LeftSquare '['
    • RightSquare ']'
    • LeftCurly '{'
    • RightCurly '}'
    • EqualSign '='
    • Dash '-'
    • UnderScore '_'
    • Comma ','
    • Period '.'
    • Colon ':'
    • SemiColon ';'
    • Bar '|'
    • Slash '/'
    • BackSlash '\'
    • NonSlash anything but '/'
    • AtSign '@'
    • NonAtSign anything but '@'
    • Pound '#'
    • Star '*'
    • Plus '+'
    • QuestionMark '?'
    • Exclamation '!'
    • LineTerm any character that causes a new line to start (\n, \r, etc.)
    • NonLineTerm anything other than a LineTerm
    • WhiteSpace any non-printing character
    • Quote the quote character
    • NonQuote anything except the quote character
    • Any any legal character, but not end-of-file
    • Digit 0-9
    • NonDigit anything except 0-9
    • Percent '%'

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • check

        public static boolean check(char ch,
            java.lang.String target)
        Return true if the character ch is the character described by the Alphabet string. For example: if ch = 'a' and target = 'SmLtr' then return true. For all the categorical targets (e.g. "LtrOrDigit") we check for a non-Latin alphabet character that meets the definition.
        Parameters:
        ch - the character to be checked
        target - a String containing one of the Alphabet terms recognized (see above).
